Area Code 812 Location: Where is 812 Area Code Coming From?

The 812 area code is located in the southern third of Indiana state, including cities like Evansville, Bloomington, Bedford, Jasper, Greensburg, Seymour, Vincennes, Terre Haute, and parts of the Louisville and Cincinnati metropolitan areas. It has only one overlay, 930, that serves the same region.

Area code 812 serves a total of 38 counties: Vanderburgh, Monroe, Clark, Vigo, Bartholomew, Floyd, Warrick, Lawrence, among 30 others.

Below is the tabular illustration of the top 30 locations (based on the population) served or covered by area code 812 in the state of Indiana.

City/Town County TimeZone Evansville, IN Vanderburgh Central Bloomington, IN Monroe Eastern Terre Haute, IN Vigo Eastern Jeffersonville, IN Clark Eastern Columbus, IN Bartholomew Eastern New Albany, IN Floyd Eastern Clarksville, IN Clark Eastern Vincennes, IN Knox Eastern Seymour, IN Jackson Eastern Jasper, IN Dubois Eastern Bedford, IN Lawrence Eastern Madison, IN Jefferson Eastern Washington, IN Daviess Eastern Greensburg, IN Decatur Eastern Princeton, IN Gibson Central Brazil, IN Clay Eastern Charlestown, IN Clark Eastern Tell City, IN Perry Centra Scottsburg, IN Scott Eastern North Vernon, IN Jennings Eastern Mount Vernon, IN Posey Central Batesville, IN Franklin Eastern Ellettsville, IN Monroe Eastern Salem, IN Washington Eastern Boonville, IN Warrick Central Sellersburg, IN Clark Eastern Huntingburg, IN Dubois Eastern Hidden Valley, IN Dearborn Eastern Bright, IN Dearborn Eastern Linton, IN Greene Eastern Show more

Choose 812 as your number, complete the payment procedure, and activate your number. After activation, you can send and receive calls and text messages.

812 Area Code History – Where Does a 812 Area Code Originate?

812 Area Code originated from the state of Indiana in the United State. It is one of the original area codes in North American Numbering plan (NANP) created in 1947 January 1, which originally served southern Indiana. And on that exact date, it officially went into service.

However, due to the high demand for pagers, mobile phones, and other communication services, the 812 area code overlaid with the 930 area code in 2015. For local calls dialing pattern for both area codes are 10 digits (10D).

The 812 area code is the telephone number code for the southern third of Indiana state, US. It covers 38 counties, including cities like Evansville, Bloomington, Bedford, Jasper, Greensburg, Seymour, Vincennes, Terre Haute, and parts of the Louisville and Cincinnati metropolitan areas. It has only one overlay, 930, that serves the same region.

Country USA State Florida Major Cities Terre Haute, Bloomington, Seymour, Evansville, Columbus Time Zone Eastern Time (ET) and Central Time Telephone Number Format +1 (812) XXX-XXXX (+1 country code)

The area code 812 is located in Indiana (IN), US and serves Evansville, Madison, Columbus, Bloomington, New Albany, Jeffersonville, Terre Haute, and some other surrounding cities.

The cities like Evansville, Bloomington, Bedford, Jasper, Greensburg, Seymour, Vincennes, and Terre Haute of state of Indiana, United States have an 812 area code.

No, the 812 area code does not belong to Ohio. Area code 812 is in southern Indiana, US. Ohio’s area codes are 216, 234, 330, 419, 440, 513, 567, 283, 614, 740, 380, 220, 326, and 937.

An 812 comes from the southern third of Indiana state, US. It was officially created and assigned in 1947 January 1. It covers cities like Evansville, Bloomington, Bedford, Jasper, Greensburg, Seymour, Vincennes, and Terre Haute.

The time zone of the 812 area code is the Eastern Time Zone (ET), also referred to as America/New_York and Central Time Zone (CT), also referred to as America/Chicago.

It depends on the features that the service provider offers. However, KrispCall 812 area code number allows you to share multimedia messages, text messages, and phone calls.

It is true that the 812 area code is a legitimate telephone area code. However, recent technological advancements have enabled unique telephone numbers to be created more easily.

That’s why sometimes it can be a scam call. You can purchase a legit one from renowned area code phone number providers such as Krispcall. Usually, free virtual phone number providers provide scam 812 area codes.
